item.title: Report E-2025060234
item.description:
Report E-2025060234

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CANTON RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Wednesday, June 11, 2025, at approximately 1730 hours, a CSXT crew noticed a tank car (UTLX 212517) leaking a liquid substance from the top of the car. After a call from the CSX Yardmaster at approximately 1733 hours, a Canton employee walked out to inspect the railcar. It was determined that the leak was coming from the top of the tank car, out of the pressure relief valve, located under the top fitting protection cover. This leak was due to the car being loaded during the winter months and the product inside the tank expanding due to sunlight warming the side of the tank, causing the contents to expand, thus reducing the available head space in the car. A Canton Railroad transload employee came out at 1907 hours and pumped 200 gallons out of the car to prevent further dripping out of the safety valve.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO WHITE BELT FOR A GROUND LEAKER HAZMAT PACKAGE ON THE BELT. RESPONDED WIT FULL PPE, DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. DAMAGE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE, PACKAGE HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL SO RESPONDER FOLLOWED APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CONTAINED THE PACKAGE AND RETURND TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2025060559
item.description:
Report X-2025060559

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-05
  • City: ABERDEEN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE DUE TO THE SOUND OF DRY ICE ROLLING AROUND IN THE BOX AND THE OUTER BOX STATING PERISHABLE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2025060243
item.description:
Report X-2025060243

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-02
  • City: ABERDEEN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO FOUR AIR PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THE PACKAGES ALSO CONTAIN PROPAK REFRIGERANT GEL PACKS, NOT REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1Z94241YNY00888814, 1Z94241YNY27443397 AND 1Z94241YNY21808263. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2025051677
item.description:
Report X-2025051677

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: GAITHERSBURG
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL, RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE OUTER PACKAGING WAS VERY DAMAGED AND HAD NO OUTSIDE MARKINGS. RESPONDER COULD SEE INSIDE THE PACKAGE AS IT WAS TORN OPEN AND OBSERVED A OXIDIZER 5.1 DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL ON THE CONTENTS. THEN PUT ON PPE AND TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, IDENTIFIED THE MATERIALS AS A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED HAZMAT. THEN CONTACTED THE CEC AND HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTION.

item.title: Report E-2025050294
item.description:
Report E-2025050294

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: CUMBERLAND
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival at the relay terminal, the drum was discovered to be leaking inside the trailer. Investigation revealed that the drum may have had a piece of freight or skid accidentally pushed into it, causing a dent and a small puncture. The drum was immediately placed into an overpack container to prevent further release. The released material was neutralized and containerized for disposal. Due to the hazard of material, the packaging specs were not able to be obtained.
